title: Projects
text:
Below are selected projects showcasing business insight, storytelling, dashboards, and analytics workflows.




Overview:
Analyzed global video game sales data to uncover trends in genre popularity, platform performance, and regional demand.
Key Focus: - Sales trends across regions and time
- Top-performing genres and platforms
- Data-driven recommendations for product strategy
Tools: Excel, Tableau, PowerPoint, SQL





Overview:
Conducted exploratory and predictive analysis on influenza mortality data to support healthcare staffing and resource allocation decisions.
Key Focus: - State-level flu mortality trends
- Risk analysis for populations aged 65+
- Interactive dashboards for planning
Tools: Excel, Tableau, Python
Links:
- GitHub: Repository





Overview:
Performed advanced SQL analysis on customer, rental, and payment data to support Rockbusterâ€™s transition into online video rentals. Key Focus: - Database design & ER diagrams
- Customer and revenue analysis
- Regional performance insights
Tools: PostgreSQL, SQL, Tableau, Power BI, DbVisualizer
Links:
- GitHub: Repository





Overview:
Analyzed large-scale grocery transaction data to uncover customer purchasing patterns and segmentation insights.
Key Focus: - Customer loyalty and ordering behavior
- Product and department performance
- Marketing and sales optimization insights
Tools: Python (Pandas, NumPy), Jupyter, Excel
Links:
- GitHub: Repository





Overview:
Analyzed over 260,000 incidents to uncover temporal, geographic, and severity patterns using exploratory analysis, clustering, and time-series methods.
Key Focus: - Time-series trends and seasonality
- Geographic distribution and hotspots
- Clustering of incident types and severity patterns
Tools: Python, Tableau, Jupyter
Links:
- GitHub: Repository

title: About
text:
I am a Data Analyst with a foundation in Mechanical Engineering, holding a Bachelor of Engineering degree and an Automotive Master Certificate from the Community College of Baltimore County. Over the years, I worked extensively with diagnostic data, performance metrics, and system troubleshooting, experiences that shaped my analytical thinking and attention to detail.
My transition into data analytics was driven by a growing interest in how data patterns, trends, and visualizations can influence strategic decisions. Through the CareerFoundry Data Analytics program, I gained hands-on experience delivering end-to-end analytics projects using Python, SQL, Tableau, Excel, and Power BI.
What sets me apart is the combination of engineering discipline and data storytelling. Iâ€™m comfortable working with complex datasets and equally comfortable translating insights for non-technical stakeholders. My goal is always to connect analysis to business value, operational efficiency, and informed decision-making.
I am currently open to full-time Data Analyst opportunities and enjoy collaborating with teams that value clarity, evidence-based strategy, and continuous improvement.

title: Home
text:
Data Analyst | Business Intelligence | Data Storytelling
Turning complex data into clear, actionable business insights




Iâ€™m a Data Analyst with a Mechanical Engineering background, bringing a structured, analytical mindset to data-driven decision-making. My journey from engineering and automotive diagnostics into analytics allows me to approach data problems with precision, curiosity, and a strong focus on real-world impact.
I specialize in SQL, Python, Tableau, Excel, and Power BI, working across the full analytics lifecycleâ€”from data cleaning and validation to insight generation and storytelling. I donâ€™t just analyze numbers; I focus on why patterns exist, what they mean for the business, and how insights can drive smarter decisions.
